so before July 12th 2018 the way peps worked and to peps are uh are python
enhancement proposals and they're very much based on the um ietf RFC system
basically uh what would happen is if someone had a major change they wanted to make to python typically this is
language level uh it can be modul level but it was kind of a gut feel of what really required a pep and what didn't
but basically we would write this document that would uh give an abstract of what you wanted to change a rational
of why you wanted to change it uh an explanation of exactly what that change
was uh hopefully an implementation uh discussions of backwards and compatibility problems potentially um
and then also act as a historical document of what came up in the discussion of this idea
uh because peps tend to lead to changes to the language it tend to be fairly
controversial with some people and so the uh pep also records like rejected ideas and why they were rejected uh and
if it's in the middle of a conversation any current open issues that are still open for debate uh but basically that's
it it just becomes a document that records uh a proposal for an idea and uh
before the faithful retirement day what would happen was uh Guido
would either choose to make a pronouncement himself and either accept
it or reject it uh or uh in the last few years uh he added the concept of bdfl
delegates uh where basically Guido would say look I don't have enough uh domain
specific knowledge in this area but this other person does and I trust them to make a good decision so I'm going to
delegate my bdfl powers for this one pep to them and then they would play that role so they would be the one that you
would have to convince they would be the one that would provide the feedback and ultimately they would be the ones that would make the call of whether to accept
or reject the pep and that basically it uh and anyone technically could uh make
a python enhancement proposal uh it is open to the public we do ask people to
propose the idea first to a main list called uh python ideas that's python Dash ideas if you're going to search for

there's a decent chance your ideas come up before uh and then if the general
